variant.name: GoogleDrive
variant.summary: The file was opened using the file task for Google Drive/Workspace

variant.name: OneDrive
variant.summary: The file was opened using the file task for OneDrive/Microsoft 365

variant.name: GetDeltaIncremental
variant.summary: incremental delta HTTP call

variant.name: GetDeltaInitial
variant.summary: initial delta HTTP call

variant.name: GetDelta
variant.summary: delta HTTP call fetching a single results page

variant.name: GetDeltaAllIncremental
variant.summary: incremental delta fetch (sum of all result pages)

variant.name: GetDeltaAllInitial
variant.summary: initial delta fetch (sum of all result pages)

variant.name: GetDeltaIncremental
variant.summary: incremental delta HTTP call fetching a single results page

variant.name: GetDeltaInitial
variant.summary: initial delta HTTP call fetching a single results page

variant.name: android_files
variant.summary: Android 'Play Files'

variant.name: archive
variant.summary: Mounted Archive (eg. ZIP, RAR, etc)

variant.name: computer
variant.summary: Root of a specific Computer

variant.name: computers_grand_root
variant.summary: Root of Drive's 'Computers' view

variant.name: crostini
variant.summary: Crostini Home Directory

variant.name: documents_provider
variant.summary: ARC DocumentsProvider

variant.name: downloads
variant.summary: Downloads directory

variant.name: drive
variant.summary: Google Drive

variant.name: drive_fake_root
variant.summary: Fake root of all My Drive etc

variant.name: drive_offline
variant.summary: Drive's 'Offline' view

variant.name: drive_recent
variant.summary: Recent files on Drive

variant.name: drive_shared_with_me
variant.summary: Drive's 'Shared with Me' view

variant.name: external_media
variant.summary: Root of an external media folder under Computers grand root

variant.name: media_view
variant.summary: ARC MediaView

variant.name: mtp
variant.summary: MTP device (eg. phone, camera)

variant.name: my_files
variant.summary: My Files

variant.name: recent
variant.summary: Recent view

variant.name: removable
variant.summary: Removable storage (eg. USB)

variant.name: shared_drives_grand_root
variant.summary: Root of 'Shared Drives'

variant.name: smb
variant.summary: Server Message Block

variant.name: team_drive
variant.summary: Root of a specific Shared Drive

variant.name: trash
variant.summary: Trash folder

variant.name: unknown
variant.summary: Unknown root type

histogram.name: DriveCommon.Lifecycle.FirstLaunchTime
histogram.summary: How long did it take to launch Google Drive for the first time.

histogram.name: DriveCommon.Lifecycle.Mount
histogram.summary: Records outcomes of attempts to mount Google Drive.

histogram.name: DriveCommon.Lifecycle.MountTime
histogram.summary: How long did it take to mount Google Drive.

histogram.name: DriveCommon.Lifecycle.Unmount
histogram.summary: Records outcomes of attempts to unmount Google Drive.

histogram.name: DriveCommon.LocalSearch.OfflineSearchTime
histogram.summary: How long did it take to perform a lookup of pinned files in local Google Drive cache.

histogram.name: DriveCommon.LocalSearch.SharedSearchTime
histogram.summary: How long did it take to perform a search of shared files in local Google Drive cache.

histogram.name: DriveCommon.LocalSearch.TextSearchTime
histogram.summary: How long did it take to search a title in local Google Drive cache.

histogram.name: DriveCommon.RemoteSearch.SharedSearchTime
histogram.summary: How long did it take to perform a search of shared files in online Google Drive.

histogram.name: DriveCommon.RemoteSearch.TextSearchTime
histogram.summary: How long did it take to perform a search in online Google Drive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ChangeDirectory.RootType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Counts the number of directory-changed events, bucketed by the RootType of the directory newly displayed.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ComputersCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of Computers a user has available in the Files app. Computed every time the File Browser is opened (including file picker dialogs). NOTE: This data is biased towards users that use the Files App more often.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DirectoryListLoad.{RootType}.{NumFiles}
histogram.summary: Tracks the user perceived load time for the directory list. Measured from the beginning of the directory scan until all entries are scanned (excluding metadata). {NumFiles} has a tolerance of 20% which leads to the following buckets being tracked: 8-12 files, 80-120 files and 800-1200 files all inclusive. Directories whose file counts fall outside these buckets are simply not recorded. {RootType} is used to differentiate the load times for various volumes.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DirectoryScan
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time to scan a directory. Measured on every File Browser directory change.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DirectoryTree.Expand.{RootType}
histogram.summary: How long it takes to expand a directory. Measured each time a directory is expanded from the directory tree or file list / grid and patterned for all known volume types.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Diversion.Commit.{Reason}.{Part}
histogram.summary: The error code returned when committing a (temporary) diversion file to its (persistent) backing file system, broken down by whether we stopped because of an explicit finish (e.g. the shadowed file was renamed) or an idle timeout. There are two parts to the diversion process. The first part concerns any errors when reading from or writing to the work-in-progress temporary file. The second part concerns moving the now-complete temporary file to the backing file system.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Diversion.EnsureFileExists.ShouldDivert
histogram.summary: Whether we should start redirecting I/O to a diversion file, whenever DiversionBackendDelegate::EnsureFileExists is called.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadDestination.IsGoogleDrive.Changed
histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder when the download destination is changed by the user in the settings page.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadDestination.IsGoogleDrive.Started
histogram.summary: Tracks whether download destination is set to a Google Drive folder on startup.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Downloads.DirectoryPercentageOfDiskUsage
histogram.summary: The size of the space consumed by a user's files in the 'MyFiles' folder and its children, calculated as a percentage of the total disk space. Calculated on user login and recorded by VolumeManager.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Downloads.DirectorySizeMiB
histogram.summary: The total size of all of the user's files stored in the 'MyFiles' folder and its children. Calculated on user login and recorded by VolumeManager.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DownloadsCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of files and directories in the Downloads directory (not including the contents of nested directories). Computed every time the File Browser current directory changes to Downloads.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DriveHostedFilePinSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks success rate of pinning hosted files in Drive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DriveOfflineHostedCount.{OpenIsAvailable}.AvailablePercent
histogram.summary: Percent of total Drive hosted files that are available offline, recorded when a hosted Drive file is opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DriveOfflineHostedCount.{OpenIsAvailable}.{DocsOfflineCounts}
histogram.summary: Count of Drive hosted files that are or are not available offline, recorded when a hosted Drive file is opened. Zero represents errors when docs offline extension was not available to query. All values are increased by 1 so we can differentiate between errors (0-bucket) and zero count (1-bucket), but this will make little difference after the first few buckets since bucket size grows large for this 100K histogram with 50 buckets.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DriveOfflineOpen.{OpenIsAvailable}
histogram.summary: File types that are or are not available offline when opened, recorded when a Drive file is opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.DrivePinSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks success rate of pinning files in Drive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ExtractTask.Status
histogram.summary: Tracks success/error rate of extracting archive contents.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FileSystemProviderMounted
histogram.summary: The type of file system provider that has been mounted. This metric is emmitted on mounting of the filesystem.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Add
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user adds a folder shortcut.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Count
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of saved folder shorcuts. This is recorded when the Files app is launched.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Navigate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user clicks or selects a folder shortcut and is navigated to the target folder.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FolderShortcut.Remove
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this is recorded when the user removes a folder shortcut.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.FormatFileSystemType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this records the filesystem selected when formatting an external drive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Fusebox.RPC.{FileSystemType}.{RpcMethod}
histogram.summary: The error code returned by the Fusebox D-Bus RPC server, broken down by the storage::FileSystemType of the RPC argument and the RPC method name.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Glitch
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: this records errors and rejected promises that occurred during regular use of File Manager. The purpose of this metric is to report unexpected errors caught by the global window.onerror handler or global unhandledrejection listener. In normal conditions this should never happen. However, if it occurs, it is a sign of significant and unexpected errors which must not go undetected.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.CHOOBEScreenInitializations
histogram.summary: During CHOOBE (CHoose your own Out-Of-Box Experience) the Drive bulk pinning screen lists all the users files to see if all eligible files can fit on the device. This metric captures the number of times after the listing of eligible files begun that bulk pinning had to initialize. Any number greater than 1 indicates multiple restarts and possible recalculation. This does not capture restarts that may have occurred prior to bulk pinning starting calculation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.CHOOBEScreenStage
histogram.summary: The stage the bulk pinning feature was at when the CHOOBE (CHoose your own Out-Of-Box Experience) manager asked if the drive pinning screen should be skipped or not. The screen will only show if the stage is "Success", all other stages will cause the screen to be skipped.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.Enabled
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the Google Drive bulk-pinning feature is enabled on eligible devices. This is sampled once per hour, and on eligible devices only.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.Enabled.Source
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records which UI surface was used to enable bulk pinning each time it is enabled.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.EnableDocsOffline
histogram.summary: Result returned when trying to enable Docs offline functionality as part of enabling the File sync feature.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.Listing.Error
histogram.summary: The final error state that the Google Drive bulk-pinning feature reached while listing files.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.MultipleMountFailures
histogram.summary: Records the reason DriveFS fails to mount consecutively

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.OfflineOpen
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: File types that a user attempts to open for users who have bulk pinning enabled when their device is offline, recorded when a Drive file is opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.PinnedFiles
histogram.summary: Counts each file that gets succesfully pinned or not by the Google Drive bulk-pinning feature.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.Pinning.Error
histogram.summary: Error returned by DriveFS when the bulk-pinning manager tries to pin a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.QueueSize
histogram.summary: The maximum number of files that can be concurrently downloaded by the bulk-pinning manager. This is recorded every time the bulk-pinning manager starts pinning files, after having enumerated all the files to pin.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.StateWhenCacheVolumeRemoved
histogram.summary: If the LVM cache volume was identified as having been removed, this metric is emitted with the current state of bulk pinning (regardless of the state it will get disabled, this just captures the state at the time).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.Syncing.Error
histogram.summary: The final error state that the Google Drive bulk-pinning feature reached while syncing files.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.TimeSpentListing
histogram.summary: Time spent listing eligible files in a users Google Drive. The listing of files happens when the user first goes through OOBE, when they open the Google Drive settings page or when the click Get started on the bulk pinning banner. For the first file listing it will typically make a query to the cloud and can take a long time, subsequent queries are done on cached data and happen relatively quickly. This is only emitted if the initial listing finished successfully.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.BulkPinning.ToDownloadMiB
histogram.summary: Total amount of data that the Google Drive bulk-pinning feature is about to download. This is the sum of the sizes of the files that the bulk-pinning manager is about to pin and that are not locally cached yet. This metric is collected when the bulk-pinning manager is starting to pin files, after it ensured there is enough local storage space.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.DailyDSSAvailabilityPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of Docs/Sheets/Slides that are available offline compared to the total number of known Docs/Sheets/Slides by DriveFS. A file is considered known if DriveFS has cached the metadata for the file. Docs offline can see many more files then DriveFS so we prune the list of known files before sending this metric. This is emitted after at least 1 day has elapsed since the last time it was emitted.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.GoogleDrive.DSSAvailabilityPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of Docs/Sheets/Slides that are available offline compared to the total number of known Docs/Sheets/Slides by DriveFS. A file is considered known if DriveFS has cached the metadata for the file. Docs offline can see many more files then DriveFS so we prune the list of known files before sending this metric. This is emitted during the polling of Docs offline which happens if at least one Files app window is open and only emitted if the values changed from the last update.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.HoldingSpace.TimeFromFirstWelcomeBannerShowToFirstPin
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files App: Records the time from when the holding space welcome banner was first shown to when the user first pinned an item to holding space from the Files app. If the holding space welcome banner was not shown prior to the first pin, zero is recorded.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Load{FileBrowserLoad}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser is an built-in extension without a background page. Its main.html file is loaded every time the user opens a File Browser tab or a file chooser dialog. The file is fairly large and the initialization is pretty expensive. {FileBrowserLoad}

variant.name: .BackgroundLaunch
variant.summary: Time from onLaunched event is called to the window is created.

variant.name: .BackgroundRestart
variant.summary: Time to create a window on restart.

variant.name: .BackgroundScript
variant.summary: Time to initialize backend script to wait for events.

variant.name: .ImportElements
variant.summary: Time to initialize the polymer elements.

variant.name: .InitBackgroundPage
variant.summary: Time to initialize the background page.

variant.name: .InitDocuments
variant.summary: Time to initialize the background page and the elements.

variant.name: .InitSettings
variant.summary: Time to restore user settings.

variant.name: .InitUI
variant.summary: Time to initialize all UI after all elements are initialized.

variant.name: .ProcessInitialSearchQuery
variant.summary: Time to process LaunchParam.searchQuery (time to find a query-matched directory).

variant.name: .Script
variant.summary: Time to parse Javascript and CSS.

variant.name: .Total
variant.summary: Total load time from the moment the Javascript started parsing till the moment the empty file list is displayed.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Location.OnEntryExpandedOrCollapsed.NonTopLevel
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files App: The locations (root types) of non-top-level entries when they are expanded or collapsed (expand icon clicked) in the directory tree.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Location.OnEntryExpandedOrCollapsed.TopLevel
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files App: The locations (root types) of top-level entries (root entries) when they are expanded or collapsed (expand icon clicked) in the directory tree.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Location.OnEntrySelected.NonTopLevel
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files App: The locations (root types) of non-top-level entries when they are clicked in the directory tree. Contains incomplete data from M80 to M87 inclusively.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Location.OnEntrySelected.TopLevel
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files App: The locations (root types) of top-level entries (root entries) when they are clicked in the directory tree. Contains incomplete data from M80 to M87 inclusively.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.MenuItemSelected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files App: The commands selected in the menu by the files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Notification.Show
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Notification types what were shown to the user.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Notification.UserAction
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The action a user takes when shown a notification.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Errors.Drive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Errors that can occur when opening an Office file on Drive with Google Drive Web.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Errors.OneDrive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Errors that can occur when opening an Office file on OneDrive with the Microsoft 365 PWA.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Errors.{CloudProvider}.MetricState
histogram.summary: The state of the FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Errors.{CloudProvider} metric.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.FileHandler.{RootType}.{ConnectionStatus}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Counts the number of times each file handler is used to open MS Office files from Files app.

variant.name: Drive
variant.summary: The file is located on Drive

variant.name: NotDrive
variant.summary: The file is not located on Drive

variant.name: Offline
variant.summary: The user is offline

variant.name: Online
variant.summary: The user is online

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.FileOpen.Time.{Transfer}.{Size}.To.{CloudProvider}
histogram.summary:
Chrome OS File app: Latency to open a Office file in the {CloudProvider}.
Measured from the time after the user confirmed the copy/move, to ignore the time waiting for user confirmation. If no confirmation is required, it starts from the time that the confirmation would be displayed. The end time is just before asking the browser to open the file/URL in tab/PWA.

variant.name: Copy
variant.summary: The files have been copied to {CloudProvider}

variant.name: Move
variant.summary: The files have been moved to {CloudProvider}

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.AuthAttempt
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: OneDrive OAuth flow attempts. Recorded at the start of the flow.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.AuthResult.Automated
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: OneDrive automated OAuth flow result. Recorded during the fully automated OneDrive setup flow (initiated by an enterprise policy) at the end of the flow.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.AuthResult.Interactive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: OneDrive interactive OAuth flow result. Recorded at the end of the flow.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.AuthResult.NonInteractive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: OneDrive non-interactive OAuth flow result. Recorded at the end of the flow.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.AutomatedMountResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: OneDrive automated mount result. Recorded during the fully automated OneDrive setup flow (initiated by an enterprise policy) at the end of the flow.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.DriveType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: type of the user's Drive, according to the Graph API. Recorded on service worker startup.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.FileSize.{Direction}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: size of files transfered to/from ODFS.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.FileSystemProvider.Completion.{API-FSP}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Breakdown of how many times ODFS fileSystemProviderHandler handler completed successfully, completed after a warning is shown, aborted via the notification or aborted automatically.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.FileSystemProvider.Error.{API-FSP}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Result returned by ODFS fileSystemProviderHandler handler.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.FileSystemProvider.ExtendedError.{ExtendedFSPOperation}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: FSP requests error results, recorded from ODFS.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.FileSystemProvider.Time.{API-FSP}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: ODFS fileSystemProviderHandler handler execution time.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.GraphAPI.DeltaSize.{Case}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of entries returned in one Graph API delta call (this includes multiple requests to fetch all result pages of one delta request).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.GraphAPI.LastResponseCode.{GetDeltaCallType}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records the status code of the last request in a logical group of "get delta" calls, where each request fetches a single page.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.GraphAPI.ResponseCode.{GraphAPIMethod}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: HTTP response code of select Microsoft GraphAPI calls. These histograms are deprecated in favour of the "ResponseCodeSparse" variant.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.GraphAPI.ResponseCodeSparse.{GraphAPIMethod}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: HTTP response code of select Microsoft GraphAPI calls.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.GraphAPI.Time.{GraphAPIMethod}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: latency of select Microsoft GraphAPI calls.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.MimeType.{Direction}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: type of files transferred to/from ODFS.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.MountStatePostRestore
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: ODFS mount state in Chrome and local storage after running the restoration of existing mounts.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.MountStatePreRestore
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: ODFS mount state in Chrome and local storage before running the restoration of existing mounts.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.ThirdPartyAuthResult
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: OneDrive automated third party authentication flow result. Recorded during the fully automated OneDrive setup flow using a third party identity provider (initiated by an enterprise policy) at the end of the flow.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.Throughput.{Direction}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: ODFS file transfer speed to/from Microsoft OneDrive.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.Version
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: version of the ODFS extension on service worker startup. The version string is encoded in 9 bits to fit max histogram buckets (1002), major: 1 bit (MSB), minor: 3 bits, patch: 5 bits.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.ODFS.WebUrlFormat
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: the format of webUrl in a OneDrive item returned by the Graph API. Emitted by ODFS.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.CloudProvider
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records the initial cloud provider selected to open a file. Record Google Drive or OneDrive cloud provider if a file is being opened with Drive web or Microsoft 365, respectively. Record Unknown if an unknown cloud provider is used and record None if no cloud provider used.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.FileType.{CloudProvider}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records the extension of office files that are being opened with Drive web or Microsoft 365.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.IOTaskError.{CloudProvider}.{Transfer}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records the error during upload in the "upload and open" workflow for Office files. This metric should add up to the sum of FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.UploadResult.* where the result is a copy or move operation error (IO task errors).

variant.name: Copy
variant.summary: The files have been copied to {CloudProvider}

variant.name: Move
variant.summary: The files have been moved to {CloudProvider}

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.IOTaskError.{CloudProvider}.{Transfer}.MetricState
histogram.summary: The state of the FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.IOTaskError.{CloudProvider}.{Transfer} metric.

variant.name: Copy
variant.summary: The files have been copied to {CloudProvider}

variant.name: Move
variant.summary: The files have been moved to {CloudProvider}

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.NumberOfFiles.{CloudProvider}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records the initial number of files selected when opening with Drive web or Microsoft 365.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.SourceVolume.{CloudProvider}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records the source volume an office file is opened from.

variant.name: GoogleDrive
variant.summary: The file was opened using the file task for Google Drive/Workspace

variant.name: MicrosoftOneDrive
variant.summary: The file was opened using the file task for OneDrive/Microsoft 365

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.SourceVolume.{CloudProvider}.MetricState
histogram.summary: The state of the FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.SourceVolume.{CloudProvider} metric.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.TransferRequired.{CloudProvider}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records whether an office file must be transferred to Google Drive or Microsoft OneDrive in order to open it.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.TransferRequired.{CloudProvider}.MetricState
histogram.summary: The state of the FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.TransferRequired.{CloudProvider} metric.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.UploadResult.{CloudProvider}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records the upload result of the "upload and open" workflow for Office files.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.UploadResult.{CloudProvider}.MetricState
histogram.summary: The state of the FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Open.UploadResult.{CloudProvider} metric.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Setup.CancelPage
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records the page at which the user cancels Office setup. NOTE: The OneDrive upload page does not get recorded as you cannot 'cancel' setup at that point.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Setup.FileHandlerSelection
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The file handler the user selects to open an Office file with on the first page of setup.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Setup.FirstTimeMicrosoft365Availability
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The state of MS365 PWA and ODFS on first setup launch.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Setup.ODFSAvailability
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Availability of the ODFS extension when mount is requested (not including retries within the same flow).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Setup.OfficeWebAppInstallation
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records installation result code for the installation attempt for the Office web app initiated through the Office setup flow.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.Setup.OfficeWebAppOfflineInstallation
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: Records installation result code for the offline installation attempt for the Office web app initiated through the Office setup flow.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.TaskResult.{CloudProvider}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The result of the task that opens an Office file using Drive or OneDrive.

variant.name: Drive
variant.summary: The task is for Google Drive/Docs

variant.name: OneDrive
variant.summary: The task is for Microsoft OneDrive/Office

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.TaskResult.{CloudProvider}.MetricState
histogram.summary: The state of the FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.TaskResult.{CloudProvider} metric.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OfficeFiles.UseOutsideDrive
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: When a user uses a MS Office file outside of Drive, records which file system operation is used (File picker selection, Copy/Move/Zip or Open from files app).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OpenFiles.RootType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The locations (root types) of files which are opened by the file picker.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.DialogType
histogram.summary: File dialog type (e.g. Full page, Save as file) when quick view is launched.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.FileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be opened with quick view.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.FileTypeOnLaunch
histogram.summary: File types that were selected when quick view is launched.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.VolumeType
histogram.summary: The volume type where quick view is opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.QuickView.WayToOpen
histogram.summary: How quick view was opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Recent.FilterByType
histogram.summary: This is recorded when different filter buttons in Recent view are clicked.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Recent.LoadArcMedia
histogram.summary: Time to load a recently modified file list from Media Views. It is triggered when the user opens or reloads Recent view in the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Recent.LoadCrostini
histogram.summary: Time to load a recently modified file list from Crostini. It is triggered when the user opens or reloads Recent view in the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Recent.LoadDownloads
histogram.summary: Time to load a recently modified file list from Downloads. It is triggered when the user opens or reloads Recent view in the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Recent.LoadDrive
histogram.summary: Time to load a recently modified file list from Drive. It is triggered when the user opens or reloads Recent view in the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Recent.LoadFileSystemProvider
histogram.summary: Time to load a recently modified file list from a FileSystemProvider file system. It is triggered when the user opens or reloads Recent view in the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Recent.LoadTotal
histogram.summary: Time to load a recently modified file list from all sources. It is triggered when the user opens or reloads Recent view in the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Search.ResultCount
histogram.summary: ChromeOS File Browser: The number of results returned by a search query.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Search.RootType
histogram.summary: ChromeOS File Browser: the root type in which search opened. Search can be opened in either the Standalone mode or in the Picker mode.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Search.{Source}.Latency
histogram.summary: ChromeOS File Browser: The time it took to complete user search request.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.SWA.Create
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The mode in which the Files app SWA was opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.TeamDrivesCount
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: number of Team Drives a user has available in the Files app. Computed every time the File Browser is opened (including file picker dialogs). NOTE: This data is biased towards users that use the Files App more often.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ToggleFileListType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files App: Recorded when the Grid View/List View toggle menu icon is selected.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Trash.DirectorySetupFailed
histogram.summary: Recorded when failing to create the trash folder (e.g. .Trash) and it's children (e.g. info and files).

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Trash.FailedTrashing
histogram.summary: Recorded when an item is attempted to be sent to the trash but fails.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.Trash.RestoreFailedNoParent
histogram.summary: Recorded when an item is attempted to be restored but the parent folder it originally came from no longer exists.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.TrashFiles.{RootType}
histogram.summary: Recorded when the Trash directory is loaded and all files for the {RootType} are entirely read.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.UpdateAvailableApps.{NumApps}
histogram.summary: Tracks the user perceived load time for the available apps (aka file tasks) after the user selecting the files in the file list. Measured from the throttled event selection changed (when user changes what files are selected) until all the available apps is populated in the DOM. {NumApps} has a tolerance of 80% which leads to the following buckets: 2-18 apps and 20-180 apps. Any selection outside these ranges are simply not recorded.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be viewed through browser. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingFileType.Offline
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be viewed through browser while the user is offline. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingFileType.Online
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be viewed through browser while the user is online. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingNavigationSurface.{FilesAppMode}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files app: The navigation surface used by the user to reach the file that is being opened.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingRootType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The locations (root types) of files which are opened in stand-alone mode. This does not include files opened in file picker mode.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingRootType.Offline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The locations (root types) of files which are opened in stand-alone mode while the user is offline. This does not include files opened in file picker mode.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingRootType.Online
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The locations (root types) of files which are opened in stand-alone mode while the user is online. This does not include files opened in file picker mode.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingTaskType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The type of the handler to be used to open files. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingTaskType.Offline
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The type of the handler to be used to open files when the user is offline. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingTaskType.Online
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: The type of the handler to be used to open files when the user is online. This is recorded when the user tries to view a file from the Files app.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ViewingVolumeType.{FilesAppMode}
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Files app: The volume type where the file lives at the time that the user opened the file. One record per file opened. NOTE: User might have navigated to the file via different UI Surfaces, see the ViewingSurfaceType metric for those.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.VolumeType
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: counts the number of times volumes are mounted for each volume type.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ZipMountTime.{RootType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the time to mount a ZIP archive. Times are only recorded on success.

variant.name: Drive
variant.summary: The archive to mount is located under the Drive root

variant.name: MyFiles
variant.summary: The archive to mount is a local file in 'MyFiles'

histogram.name: FileBrowser.ZipTask.Time
histogram.summary: Time for the execution of a zipping task. Times are only reported on success.

histogram.name: FileSystem.DirectoryDatabaseInit
histogram.summary: The result of FileSystemDirectoryDatabase initialization.

histogram.name: FileSystem.OriginDatabaseInit
histogram.summary: The result of FileSystemOriginDatabase initialization.

histogram.name: Unzipper.DetectEncoding.Result
histogram.summary: ZIP file path encoding, as detected by the Unzipper service.

histogram.name: Unzipper.DetectEncoding.Time
histogram.summary: Time to detect ZIP file path encoding.

histogram.name: ZipFileCreator.Result
histogram.summary: ZipFileCreator service: Result of a ZIP file creation (success, error or cancelled).
